title: Wrong folder structure in Thunderbird compared to Webmail
creator: simon213
content: Hi - have just started using Thunderbird for Android and also changed my domain and website hosting provider. When email reloaded with new domain/ website provider, there were lots of duplicate emails/ messed up folder structure in my email account - have sorted these out on webmail version of email account. However, when I load my email account to Thunderbird, theold messed up folder structure/ duplicates dispays - any ideas how I sort this out? Mnay thanks

title: Thunderbird E-Mail Client
creator: markus.bandomir
content:
I use a Thunderbird E-Mail Client on Android and I have 4 different E-Mail accounts. Everything works fine but with one of the e-mail accounts I have problems because when I send an Email with the Android App the sent E-Mail will not be stored in the sent folder. I know where I can check this in the app but it doesn't work. Maybe you can help me. My email provider is extromail.de

Thanks

Markus Bandomir

title: Thunderbird for Android icon not found after installation
creator: rickg916
content:
Downloaded and installed Thunderbird on my Android phone and synced with QR code on desktop just fine.

But there is no icon on any of the phone screens. I can open my mail by opening the app from the Settings list of installed files but no obvious way to place the app on my home page.Androi
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:134.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/134.0;os:Android 11
